text: Hon. Richard Thomas Rowley (1812 – 11 November 1887) was a British Conservative Party politician. ==Family== Rowley was the son of Clotworthy Rowley, 1st Baron Langford and Frances Rowley. He married Charlotte Shipley, daughter of William Shipley and Charlotte Williams-Wynn on 24 June 1835. Together, they had three children: * Eva Rowley (died 1904) * Gwenwydd Frances Rowley (–1892) * Conwy Greville Hercules Rowley-Conwy (1841–1900) After Charlotte died in 1871, Rowley remarried to Alice Henrietta Berners, daughter of Hugh Berners and Julia Alice Ashton, on 9 July 1872. ==Political career== He was elected MP for Harwich at a by-election in 1860 but did not seek re- election in 1865. ==Other activities== Rowley was at one point Captain in the Scots Guards, a Deputy Lieutenant of Flintshire, and Honorary Lieutenant- Colonel in the 6th Battalion, King's Royal Rifle Corps. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Deputy Lieutenants of Flintshire Category:Deputy Lieutenants in Wales Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs for English constituencies Category:UK MPs 1859–1865 Category:1812 births Category:1887 deaths
